name: Albert Einstein
clues: I was born in the 19th century and transformed physics with revolutionary theories.
I formulated the theory of special and general relativity, changing our understanding of space and time.
My famous equation E=mc² connects energy and mass, and my first name is Albert.

name: William Shakespeare
clues: I lived during the Renaissance and my work is performed worldwide centuries later.
I wrote 37 plays including tragedies, comedies, and histories, plus 154 sonnets.
My works include Hamlet, Romeo and Juliet, and Macbeth. I am known as the Bard.

name: Marilyn Monroe
clues: I became an icon of 1950s Hollywood and American popular culture.
I starred in films like "Some Like It Hot" and "Gentlemen Prefer Blondes".
I sang "Happy Birthday" to President Kennedy and was known for my blonde hair and beauty mark.

name: Michael Jordan
clues: I dominated my sport in the 1990s and am considered by many to be the greatest of all time.
I won six NBA championships with the Chicago Bulls and five MVP awards.
I wore number 23, had a successful sneaker line with Nike, and my initials are M.J.

name: Frida Kahlo
clues: I was a 20th-century Mexican artist known for my vibrant self-portraits.
My paintings often featured bold colors, surrealist elements, and explored themes of identity and pain.
I had a distinctive unibrow and often painted myself with flowers in my hair.

name: Mahatma Gandhi
clues: I led a movement for independence through non-violent civil disobedience.
I organized the Salt March in India and inspired civil rights movements worldwide.
I practiced peaceful resistance and was assassinated in 1948. My first name means "great soul".

name: Beyoncé
clues: I started my career in a successful girl group before becoming a solo superstar.
I have won over 30 Grammy Awards and performed at multiple Super Bowls.
My hit albums include "Lemonade" and "Renaissance", and I married a famous rapper.

name: Usain Bolt
clues: I am from Jamaica and became the fastest person ever recorded.
I won eight Olympic gold medals in track and field, setting world records.
I hold the 100m world record at 9.58 seconds and celebrated with a lightning bolt pose.

name: Sherlock Holmes
clues: I am a fictional detective created in the late 19th century who lives in Victorian London.
I use deductive reasoning to solve complex mysteries alongside my friend Dr. Watson.
I live at 221B Baker Street and my creator is Arthur Conan Doyle.

name: Cleopatra
clues: I ruled an ancient civilization as its last active pharaoh.
I had romantic relationships with Julius Caesar and Mark Antony.
I ruled Egypt and was known for my intelligence and beauty. I died from a snake bite.

name: Leonardo da Vinci
clues: I was a Renaissance polymath known for art, science, and invention.
I painted the Mona Lisa and The Last Supper, two of the most famous artworks.
I designed flying machines and studied human anatomy. My first name is Leonardo.

name: Oprah Winfrey
clues: I hosted the highest-rated talk show in American television history for 25 years.
I became a media mogul, actress, and philanthropist with my own network.
My book club selections became bestsellers, and my first name is unique and starts with O.

name: Serena Williams
clues: I have dominated women's tennis for over two decades with my powerful playing style.
I have won 23 Grand Slam singles titles, the most in the Open Era.
I often competed alongside my sister Venus, and my first name is Serena.

name: Darth Vader
clues: I am a villain from a famous science fiction franchise who wears black armor.
I was once a Jedi Knight before turning to the dark side of the Force.
I revealed to Luke Skywalker that I am his father in a famous movie scene.

name: Nelson Mandela
clues: I spent 27 years in prison for fighting against apartheid in South Africa.
I became the first Black president of South Africa after being released.
I won the Nobel Peace Prize and my first name is Nelson.

name: Lionel Messi
clues: I am an Argentine footballer considered one of the greatest players of all time.
I spent most of my career at Barcelona before moving to Paris and then Miami.
I won the World Cup in 2022 and have won eight Ballon d'Or awards.

name: Maya Angelou
clues: I was an American poet, author, and civil rights activist.
My autobiography "I Know Why the Caged Bird Sings" became a classic.
I recited my poem at President Clinton's inauguration. My first name is Maya.

name: James Bond
clues: I am a fictional British secret agent created by Ian Fleming.
I work for MI6 with the code number 007 and a license to kill.
I prefer my martinis shaken, not stirred, and introduce myself with my last name first.

name: Marie Curie
clues: I was a pioneering scientist who conducted groundbreaking research on radioactivity.
I was the first woman to win a Nobel Prize and the only person to win in two sciences.
I discovered radium and polonium, and my first name is Marie.

name: LeBron James
clues: I am an NBA player who has played for the Cavaliers, Heat, and Lakers.
I have won four NBA championships and four MVP awards across my career.
I was called "The Chosen One" in high school and my first name is LeBron.

name: Alexander Hamilton
clues: I was a founding father of the United States and helped shape its financial system.
I wrote most of The Federalist Papers and served as the first Secretary of the Treasury.
I died in a duel with Aaron Burr, and there's a hit Broadway musical about my life.

name: Abraham Lincoln
clues: I served as U.S. President during the Civil War and worked to preserve the Union.
I issued the Emancipation Proclamation and gave the Gettysburg Address.
I was assassinated at Ford's Theatre and am featured on the penny and five-dollar bill.

name: Harriet Tubman
clues: I escaped slavery and then returned South repeatedly to help others find freedom.
I was known as "Moses" and conducted the Underground Railroad.
During the Civil War, I served as a scout and spy for the Union Army.

name: Martin Luther King Jr.
clues: I was a Baptist minister who became the face of the civil rights movement.
I gave the famous "I Have a Dream" speech at the March on Washington in 1963.
I won the Nobel Peace Prize and have a national holiday named after me in January.

name: Rosa Parks
clues: My act of defiance became a pivotal moment in the civil rights movement.
I refused to give up my bus seat in Montgomery, Alabama in 1955.
My arrest sparked the Montgomery Bus Boycott that lasted over a year.

name: Isaac Newton
clues: I formulated the laws of motion and universal gravitation in the 17th century.
Legend says an apple falling from a tree inspired my theory of gravity.
I also made major contributions to mathematics, inventing calculus independently.

name: Charles Darwin
clues: I traveled on the HMS Beagle and studied species in the Galápagos Islands.
I proposed the theory of evolution through natural selection.
My book "On the Origin of Species" revolutionized our understanding of life on Earth.

name: Nikola Tesla
clues: I was an inventor who pioneered alternating current electricity systems.
I worked briefly for Thomas Edison before going my own way.
A modern electric car company is named after me.

name: Pablo Picasso
clues: I was a Spanish artist who co-founded the Cubist movement.
I had distinct artistic periods including the Blue Period and Rose Period.
My painting "Guernica" depicts the horrors of war, and I lived most of my life in France.

name: Vincent van Gogh
clues: I was a Dutch post-impressionist painter who struggled with mental illness.
I only sold one painting during my lifetime but am now world-famous.
My works include "Starry Night" and "Sunflowers", and I famously cut off part of my ear.

name: Stephen Hawking
clues: I was a theoretical physicist who studied black holes and cosmology.
I had ALS and communicated through a speech-generating device.
I wrote "A Brief History of Time" and appeared in The Simpsons and Star Trek.

name: Malala Yousafzai
clues: I am a Pakistani activist for female education who survived an assassination attempt.
I became the youngest Nobel Prize laureate at age 17.
My memoir is called "I Am Malala" and I continue advocating for girls' education worldwide.

name: Ruth Bader Ginsburg
clues: I was a U.S. Supreme Court Justice and pioneering advocate for gender equality.
I became a cultural icon with the nickname "Notorious R.B.G."
I served on the Supreme Court for 27 years and was only the second woman appointed.

name: Steve Jobs
clues: I co-founded a major technology company and revolutionized personal computing.
I introduced the iPhone, iPad, and helped create Pixar Animation Studios.
I was known for product launches wearing a black turtleneck and jeans.

name: Bill Gates
clues: I co-founded Microsoft and helped make personal computers accessible to everyone.
I was the world's richest person for many years.
I now focus on philanthropy through my foundation, working on global health and poverty.

name: Johnny Depp
clues: I'm known for playing eccentric and quirky characters in major film franchises.
I portrayed Captain Jack Sparrow in the Pirates of the Caribbean series.
I also played Edward Scissorhands, Willy Wonka, and the Mad Hatter.

name: Meryl Streep
clues: I have been nominated for more Academy Awards than any other actor in history.
I've played diverse roles including Margaret Thatcher, Julia Child, and Miranda Priestly.
I have won three Oscars and am considered one of the greatest actresses of all time.

name: Denzel Washington
clues: I'm a two-time Academy Award winner known for powerful dramatic performances.
I starred in Training Day, Malcolm X, and The Equalizer series.
I often portray strong, principled characters fighting for justice.

name: Tom Hanks
clues: I've played an astronaut, a soldier, a castaway, and a man with a low IQ.
I won back-to-back Oscars for Philadelphia and Forrest Gump.
I also starred in Saving Private Ryan, Cast Away, and voiced Woody in Toy Story.

name: Leonardo DiCaprio
clues: I became a teen heartthrob in the 1990s and am now an environmental activist.
I finally won my first Oscar for The Revenant after multiple nominations.
I starred in Titanic, Inception, The Wolf of Wall Street, and often work with Martin Scorsese.

name: Jennifer Lawrence
clues: I won an Oscar at age 22 and became the youngest person to accrue four nominations by 25.
I played Katniss Everdeen in The Hunger Games franchise.
I won my Oscar for Silver Linings Playbook and also played Mystique in X-Men.

name: Morgan Freeman
clues: My distinctive deep voice has narrated countless documentaries and films.
I played God in Bruce Almighty and Red in The Shawshank Redemption.
I won an Oscar for Million Dollar Baby and often play wise mentor characters.

name: Angelina Jolie
clues: I'm an Oscar-winning actress and humanitarian who works extensively with refugees.
I played Lara Croft in Tomb Raider and starred in Mr. & Mrs. Smith.
I won my Oscar for Girl, Interrupted and am also a film director.

name: Dwayne Johnson
clues: I was a professional wrestler before becoming one of Hollywood's highest-paid actors.
I'm known as "The Rock" and starred in the Fast & Furious franchise.
I also star in Jumanji films and played the demigod Maui in Moana.

name: Tom Cruise
clues: I'm known for doing my own dangerous stunts in action films.
I've played Ethan Hunt in the Mission: Impossible franchise for decades.
I also starred in Top Gun, Jerry Maguire, and Rain Man.

name: Zoe Saldana
clues: I've starred in three of the highest-grossing film franchises of all time.
I played Gamora in Guardians of the Galaxy and Neytiri in Avatar.
I also portrayed Uhura in the Star Trek reboot films.

name: Robert Downey Jr.
clues: I launched the Marvel Cinematic Universe and became one of the highest-paid actors.
I portrayed Tony Stark/Iron Man in over 10 films.
I also played Sherlock Holmes and won a Golden Globe for my MCU role.

name: Roger Federer
clues: I'm a Swiss tennis player considered one of the greatest of all time.
I won 20 Grand Slam singles titles and held the world No. 1 ranking for 310 weeks.
I'm known for my elegant playing style and sportsmanship, and I retired in 2022.

name: Tom Brady
clues: I'm an NFL quarterback who has won more Super Bowls than any other player.
I won seven Super Bowl championships with the Patriots and Buccaneers.
I played until age 45 and am considered the greatest quarterback in NFL history.

name: Michael Phelps
clues: I'm an American swimmer and the most decorated Olympian of all time.
I won 28 Olympic medals, including 23 golds, across five Olympic Games.
I won eight gold medals at the 2008 Beijing Olympics, breaking records.

name: Simone Biles
clues: I'm an American gymnast considered the greatest of all time in my sport.
I have won over 30 Olympic and World Championship medals combined.
Several gymnastic moves are named after me, and I've spoken openly about mental health.

name: Wayne Gretzky
clues: I'm a Canadian hockey player known as "The Great One."
I hold over 60 NHL records and won four Stanley Cups with the Edmonton Oilers.
My number 99 jersey is retired league-wide in the NHL.

name: Muhammad Ali
clues: I was a heavyweight boxing champion known for my speed, footwork, and confidence.
I said "I am the greatest" and "float like a butterfly, sting like a bee."
I refused military service during the Vietnam War and was a civil rights activist.

name: Megan Rapinoe
clues: I'm an American soccer player and two-time World Cup champion.
I won the Golden Boot and Golden Ball at the 2019 Women's World Cup.
I'm known for my activism for LGBTQ+ rights and equal pay in sports.

name: Cristiano Ronaldo
clues: I'm a Portuguese footballer who has played for Manchester United, Real Madrid, and Juventus.
I've won five Ballon d'Or awards and am one of the top scorers in football history.
I'm known for my athletic physique, headers, and free kicks, with the nickname CR7.

name: Tiger Woods
clues: I'm a golfer who dominated the sport in the late 1990s and 2000s.
I've won 15 major championships and completed the "Tiger Slam" in 2000-2001.
I came back from injuries to win the 2019 Masters, and my first name comes from a nickname.

name: Naomi Osaka
clues: I'm a Japanese tennis player who has won four Grand Slam singles titles.
I've been ranked world No. 1 and am known for speaking out about mental health.
I represent Japan in the Olympics and have been a powerful voice for social justice.

name: Harry Potter
clues: I'm a young wizard who discovers my magical heritage on my 11th birthday.
I attended Hogwarts School and fought against the dark wizard who killed my parents.
I have a lightning bolt scar on my forehead and was created by J.K. Rowling.

name: Batman
clues: I'm a billionaire who fights crime using gadgets, martial arts, and detective skills.
I have no superpowers but protect Gotham City with the help of Robin and Alfred.
My parents were murdered when I was a child, and my alter ego is Bruce Wayne.

name: Hermione Granger
clues: I'm known for being the brightest witch of my age and always raising my hand in class.
I'm best friends with Harry Potter and Ron Weasley at Hogwarts.
I started S.P.E.W. to advocate for house-elf rights and became Minister of Magic.

name: Yoda
clues: I'm a small, green alien who is one of the most powerful Jedi in the galaxy.
I trained Luke Skywalker and speak in a distinctive backward syntax.
I said "Do or do not, there is no try" and lived for 900 years.

name: Spider-Man
clues: I'm a teenager who gained superpowers after being bitten by a radioactive spider.
I can climb walls, shoot webs, and have a "spider-sense" that warns of danger.
My uncle Ben taught me that "with great power comes great responsibility."

name: Katniss Everdeen
clues: I volunteered to take my sister's place in a deadly televised competition.
I became the symbol of rebellion as the "Mockingjay" in a dystopian future.
I'm an expert archer from District 12 in The Hunger Games trilogy.

name: Wonder Woman
clues: I'm an Amazonian princess and warrior with superhuman strength and speed.
I wield a Lasso of Truth and indestructible bracelets from my homeland.
My real name is Diana Prince, and I'm one of DC Comics' "Trinity" heroes.

name: Elsa
clues: I have magical ice powers that I initially struggled to control.
I sang "Let It Go" while building an ice palace in the mountains.
I'm the queen of Arendelle and Anna's older sister in a Disney film.

name: Hannibal Lecter
clues: I'm a brilliant psychiatrist who is also a cannibalistic serial killer.
I helped FBI agent Clarice Starling catch another killer.
I was played by Anthony Hopkins in "The Silence of the Lambs" and ate people with "fava beans."

name: Jay Gatsby
clues: I'm a mysterious millionaire who throws lavish parties in 1920s New York.
I'm obsessed with recapturing a past romance with a woman named Daisy.
F. Scott Fitzgerald created me, and I say "old sport" frequently.

name: Atticus Finch
clues: I'm a lawyer in 1930s Alabama who defends a Black man falsely accused of rape.
My children Scout and Jem learn about justice and prejudice through my example.
I appear in "To Kill a Mockingbird" and am known for my moral courage.

name: Elizabeth Bennet
clues: I'm the second of five sisters in Regency-era England navigating marriage and society.
I initially dislike a proud gentleman named Mr. Darcy before falling in love with him.
Jane Austen created me as the protagonist of "Pride and Prejudice."

name: Ebenezer Scrooge
clues: I'm a miserly businessman who hates Christmas and says "Bah, humbug!"
I'm visited by three ghosts on Christmas Eve who show me past, present, and future.
Charles Dickens created me for "A Christmas Carol," and I ultimately reform my ways.

name: Juliet Capulet
clues: I'm a young woman from a wealthy Italian family who falls in love with my family's enemy.
I fake my death with a sleeping potion, leading to a tragic misunderstanding.
Shakespeare wrote my story with Romeo, and I famously asked "wherefore art thou?"

name: Holden Caulfield
clues: I'm a cynical teenager who was expelled from prep school and wandered New York City.
I'm obsessed with "phonies" and protecting childhood innocence.
J.D. Salinger created me as the narrator of "The Catcher in the Rye."
